summary: The House of Black and White - 5x02
title: The House of Black and White - 5x02
body:
Other Jonsa parallels: 1x04, 1x08 | 2x01, 2x06/2x07 | 3x01, 3x05, 3x07 | 4x01, 4x07 | 5x01, 5x03, 5x04, 5x05 on my blog (sorry can’t put a link because it caused my post not showing up on the tags)

This episode title: The House of Black and White

Writer: David Benioff & D.B. Weiss

1. Ale gives men courage

Sansa tried ale and she did not like it.

She asked Littlefinger why men like it so much, to which he answered that it gives some men courage..

Well Sansa, Lord Baelish didn’t have any ale. He refused it moments ago.

But there was somebody in need of some courage, and he was drinking his ale. Here is Jon during the Night’s Watch Lord Commander election.

And he won!

2. Suspicious to outsiders

Brienne of Tarth approached Sansa to offer her service. Baelish tried to push her away by playing the “family” card.

Meanwhile, before the election, Stannis Baratheon is having a talk with Jon. Stannis was frustrated having received the letter from Lyannna Mormont stating that Bear Island only acknowledged the Starks as their king.

3. Refusing an offer

Stannis offered to legitimize Jon so he can use him to control Winterfell.

While Stannis demanded Jon to kneel to him, Sansa instead had Brienne kneeling before her, offering her service.

They rejected these offers.

We know that later Sansa finally accepted Brienne as her sworn shield. I wonder if Jon later will accept an offer to become Jon Stark, Lord of Winterfell.

blog.name: bestofsophieturner
blog.title: Best of Sophie Turner
blog.description: Fan blog for the amazing and talented Sophie Turner

summary: I'm happy for Sophie and I think that she's doing everything right. But I hope that Sophie will soon be shooting in something...
question: I'm happy for Sophie and I think that she's doing everything right. But I hope that Sophie will soon be shooting in something project and develop her career more. Sophie is a very talented girl. Sorry for my English.
answer:
Yeah she’s really talented. I honestly don’t know. She’s always so secret about her projects. We didn’t hear about Heavy, Time Freak or Josie before she filmed them. And well, there is this recent example of the ADR session in LA. We still don’t know for what it was 😅

She said she will have a big tour/promo for Dark Phoenix (they’re already doing interviews etc). So I think, if she has new projects it will be for the summer. Or maybe she will film something before April. But GoT promo will arrive too, very soon, I believe 🙌

summary: Do you know any good game of thrones youtube channels or podcast that are pro Sansa and/or Jonsa?
question: Do you know any good game of thrones youtube channels or podcast that are pro Sansa and/or Jonsa?
answer:
I’m afraid not. I don’t know much about any pro Jonsa or shipping platforms but as a Sansa fan, I stay firmly away from YouTube discussion for the obvious reasons. There’s only so many harebrained theories and false interpretations you can take it before you lose interest.

But if anyone has any suggestions that might help, please share.

summary: There’s a feeling in your eyes (the shadows can’t erase)
title: There’s a feeling in your eyes (the shadows can’t erase)
body:
Inspired by @justadram‘s fic, Saskatoon Berry Pie.

Rating: Teen

Pairing: Jon/Sansa

Summary: Following the sensational and mysterious deaths of her family, Sansa Stark marries her cousin, Jon Snow, a newly appointed Sheriff in the wild country of the Arizona Territory.

AO3 Link: Chapter two

It’s lonely out here, he’d written in one of his letters. There’s little more than dusty valleys, jagged mountains, and scrawny cattle. He’d been trying to warn her how different life would be for her, how much she’d be giving up in marrying him, but she’d garnered a different sort of truth from between the lines of his steady script…loneliness.

It came off his letters in waves so strong she could almost taste it, like acid in her throat, and by then it was a familiar flavor. Jon’s mother -Sansa’s Aunt- had died in childbirth and no one, not even her own father, had know the identity of his father. This had proven to be something of a black stain on the Stark family name, which is why her own mother had always hesitated in taking Jon to important social functions. It all seemed so silly now. Everything about her life in Boston seemed so… frail and frivolous. Shattered as easily as a pretty pane of stained glass.

Now they were both orphans. To Sansa, at least, Jon is the last remaining tie to a childhood that shines now like a star in the aftermath of loss and grief. He’s the only one left to her.

summary: Til Death Do Us Part... - Wedding Day 9 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/3A6jm9nycU  Ilva the Winter had always imagined her wedding...
caption:
Til Death Do Us Part… - Wedding Day 9 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/3A6jm9nycU 

Ilva the Winter had always imagined her wedding day to be the most beautiful day of her life. And even though she loves Jon Snow more than anything else in the world, she can’t help missing the man she had planned this wedding with. But Robb Stark died on a battlefield far away from home and Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her now. Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her and Jon now. 

*A modern Game of Thrones fanfiction with a female OC describing the wedding day and Ilva’s life with Robb and with Jon*

summary: 6SS: SanSan: Runaway
title: 6SS: SanSan: Runaway
body:
“I’m a Princess and you’re not a Prince, and I have fallen for you, so let’s runaway together.”

Sandor’s heart sped up at the Princess’ declaration, eyes widening and for once, he could not think of a single retort to say; he loved her too, but he could not ask her to give everything she had for him, he didn’t deserve it.

Sansa reached out to him, gently placing her hand on his arm, when he didn’t removed it, she smiled at him, “I know this might be sudden and in a way, brazen, but I do love you - even when you have tried to keep me away, I know you love me too.”

Finally, he found his voice, “I do, but I cannot ask you to give all for me.”

“I would rather live a simple life with someone I love than a lifetime of riches with someone I abhor; Lord Joffrey might be a perfect match, but, I will never want him - I want you and nothing more, say the word and I will follow you.”

He was shaking, he loved her too much to deny her, “I will make preparations, be ready in a week and we will leave.”

summary: I also love the King Bran endgame but it also means Sansa has to leave Winterfell. But if the show really leads to book end I'm...
question: I also love the King Bran endgame but it also means Sansa has to leave Winterfell. But if the show really leads to book end I'm convinced there will be no Winterfell in the end and perhaps North too. (We've alredy seen filming photos, Winterfell will be destroyed). So maybe Stark children will be forced to find another home
answer:
Not necessarily. I think GRRM wrote Sansa as having the biggest connection to the South for a reason and I also think she’ll be in a position of power at the end of the books. Also Bran being king doesn’t mean Sansa has to leave, she’s a Stark, she can stay if she wants to and become one of his advisors but I think she’ll be doing something else.

As for that spoiler, unlike book Winterfell, show Winterfell isn’t strong enough to survive the Night King but I’m certain they’ll rebuild Winterfell again. It’s been the Stark home for thousands of years. Also they’re not building a new set just for a few scenes.

reblog.comment:
Not necessarily. I think GRRM wrote Sansa as having the biggest connection to the South for a reason and I also think she’ll be in a position of power at the end of the books. Also Bran being king doesn’t mean Sansa has to leave, she’s a Stark, she can stay if she wants to and become one of his advisors but I think she’ll be doing something else.

As for that spoiler, unlike book Winterfell, show Winterfell isn’t strong enough to survive the Night King but I’m certain they’ll rebuild Winterfell again. It’s been the Stark home for thousands of years. Also they’re not building a new set just for a few scenes.

trail.content_raw:
Not necessarily. I think GRRM wrote Sansa as having the biggest connection to the South for a reason and I also think she’ll be in a position of power at the end of the books. Also Bran being king doesn’t mean Sansa has to leave, she’s a Stark, she can stay if she wants to and become one of his advisors but I think she’ll be doing something else.

As for that spoiler, unlike book Winterfell, show Winterfell isn’t strong enough to survive the Night King but I’m certain they’ll rebuild Winterfell again. It’s been the Stark home for thousands of years. Also they’re not building a new set just for a few scenes.
trail.content:
Not necessarily. I think GRRM wrote Sansa as having the biggest connection to the South for a reason and I also think she’ll be in a position of power at the end of the books. Also Bran being king doesn’t mean Sansa has to leave, she’s a Stark, she can stay if she wants to and become one of his advisors but I think she’ll be doing something else.

As for that spoiler, unlike book Winterfell, show Winterfell isn’t strong enough to survive the Night King but I’m certain they’ll rebuild Winterfell again. It’s been the Stark home for thousands of years. Also they’re not building a new set just for a few scenes.

summary: Sansa, Cat, Young Griff - 4
question: Sansa, Cat, Young Griff - 4
answer:
Adopt Sansa who I already call my child (I coparent with Catelyn). I’d bring her singers, buy books from the Free Cities that she can read, I’d get her teachers for her high harp and bells, I will drop kick Ned when he comes near her Lady.

Be adopted by Catelyn. It would be nice to have a non-abusive mother who’ll fight to the death to keep me safe.

Marry Young Griff. Since I’m gay (God I hope my brother doesn’t read my blog), we’ll have a nice amicable marriage in which we both have lovers and we support each other wholeheartedly. I’ll finally see Elia’s son avenge her
